line_1: Britain Her Safety to your Guidance owns,
line_2: That She can sep'rate Parricides from Sons;

line_1: Yet one dear care my heart still owns,
His long-deserted House the Lobster owns,
line_2: And with close ardent Claw indents the fav'rite Stones.

line_1: It is a truth the shepherd owns,
line_2: He thought of salads more than crowns:

line_1: Happy, if that good Lady owns
line_2: My flesh was good, and picks my bones.

line_1: The trembling earth his awful presence owns,
line_2: The forest flames, the cleaving desert groans,

line_1: No more my gentle Sway he owns;
line_2: The dear Betrayer sighs and burns.

line_1: "Yet one dear care my heart still owns,
Whose finer sense each soft vibration owns
line_2: With sweet responsive sympathy of tones;

line_1: Guilt with pale brow the mimic thunder owns,
line_2: And Tyrants tremble on their blood-stain'd thrones.

line_1: With sparkling eye the blameless Plunderer owns
line_2: Her soft embraces, and endearing tones,

line_1: Such as th' offending wretch reluctant owns,
line_2: And hails its beauty with his dying groans:

line_1: And grateful France their Ancient Glory owns.
line_2: Princes by their strong Swords possest their Crowns,
The conqu'ring Maid for whom he burns;

line_1: All that in each Degree the name of Creature owns:
To your blest guidance She her safety owns,
line_2: That she can sep'rate Parricides from Sons,

line_1: "No; let not one escape who owns
line_2: This loyal blood for vengeance groans,

line_1: Thy foot he kisses, and his guilt he owns,
line_2: Tow'rds thee for pardon, while with tears and groans
